intro: Ascochilus pusillus, commonly known as the small ascochilus, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the Apiaceae family. Ascochilus pusillus is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
